layout setting: Default container for `-container-` and gutter for `-container-`, `-grid-`, `-gallery-`, `-liquid-2-`, `-liquid-3-`, `-metro-` and `-masonry-`.
container: Create a container to constrain your content. The container can be pushed to the left, right edge or center aligned.
grid: Create a responsive multi columns (and even multi rows) layout using `-grid-`.
`-@include-` grid on the parent element, pass a number list (make sure the number list count is the same with the child elements count) as a parameter.
Change the column order using `-(cols : order)-` format.
The order works the same way as flexbox-order. Basically smaller order column will goes left, bigger goes right, equal orders will go with their original order in the markup from left to right.

The child elements can be separated to multi rows using a nested list. `-( (row1 row1 row1) (row2 row2) (row3 row3 row3))-` indicate 3 rows, the first row include 3 columns, 2rd row 2 columns, 3rd row 3 columns.
If the child elements are not `-div-`s, indicate them using `-child $selector-` format in the parameter.
`-grid-` works with breakpoints to make multi layouts for different devices.
liquid-2: Make a fluid 2-columns blog layout, with a fixed sidebar and a fluid main column.
Use string `-'auto'-` to indicate the fluid main column.
Change the order using a `-map-` and gutter using a keyword `-'gutter'-`.
If the child elements are not `-div-`s, indicate them using `-child ($selector1 $selector2)-` format in the parameter.
liquid-3: Make a holy-grail layout: 2 fixed sidebars with a fluid main column.
Use string `-'auto'-` to indicate the fluid main column.
Same with `-liquid-2-`, you can change the order using a `-map-` and gutter using a keyword `-'gutter'-`.
If the child elements are not `-div-`s, indicate them using `-child ($selector1 $selector2 $selector3)-` format in the parameter.
gallery: You can change the gutter and direction.
Use breakpoints to make it works on multi devices.
If the child elements are not `-li-`s, indicate them using `-child $selector-` format in the parameter.
masonry: Make masonry layout with pure css.
diamond: Make diamond (octagon) shape layout. To reduce complexity, `-diamond-` requires `-.diamond-content-` to wrap its content.
sticky-footer: Create `-sticky-footer-` to prevent layout collapse when content is less, e.g. 404 page.
center: Make child element horizontally and vertically center aligned.

responsive-table: Display complex data tables on small screen.
Flip-scroll: IE 10+, Firefox 3.6+, Chrome 15+, Safari 4+, Opera 12.1+
Scroll: IE 10+, Firefox 3.6+, Chrome 15+, Safari 4+, Opera 10.6+
Toggle: IE 8+, Firefox 3.6+, Chrome 15+, Safari 5.1+, Opera 10.6+
Stack: IE 10+, Firefox 3.6+, Chrome 15+, Safari 4+, Opera 10.6+
validation: Html5 form validation using H5F. H5F is included in `-kit.js-` (with a little bit modification), so you don't need to add it again.
Set customized alerts information through `-<div data-info=""></div>-`.
drop-shadows: Pure css drop shadow effects. Token from Nicolas Gallagher at css-drop-shadows-without-images.
input-file: Customize `-input:file-`. Stolen from Osvaldas Valutis at styling-customizing-file-inputs-smart-way.
tabs:
Make tabs use `-input:radio-`. 
Use`-tabs-active-` to set up tab active styles and `-tabs-panel-active-` for tab panel active styles. 
To reduce complexity, `-.ro-tabs-` and `-.ro-panels-` are required.
Media-list: Separate media element and the main content into 2 columns.
flex-media: Make video or inline svg flexible within its container.

fluid-type: Make `-font-size-` or other properties change smoothly depending on the window size.
Stolen from here More on fluid-type-blogs.
responsive-type:
`-type-` works with breakpoints. 
Everything you can do with `-type-` you can do with `-responsive-type-`.
hide-text: Visually hide the text content of an element.
opacity: Set `-opacity-` property for IE8- and modern browsers.
ro-breakpoint:
A shorthand @mixin for mediaquery. 
Note: `-ro-breakpoint-` uses one breakpoint (e.g. 800) for both `-min-` and `-max-` instead of two (e.g. 799 for `-max-`, 800 for `-min-`). If you don't want this behaiver, you can use `-$breakpoint-fix: false;-` to disable it.
at-least: Apply styles to child elements when they are equal to or more than a given amount.
at-most: Apply styles to child elements when they are equal to or less than a given amount.
equal-to: Apply styles to child elements when they are equal to a given amount.
between: Apply styles to child elements when they are between 2 given amounts.
visible: Make elements visible on some portions of the viewport.
hidden: Hide elements on some portions of the viewport.

contrast: Get a light or dark color based on a given color.
By default, the light color is `-#fff-` and black color is `-#000-`, but you can use your own.
adjacent: Get a adjacent color based on a given color.
complementary: Get the complementary color based on a given color.
split-complementary: Get a split-complementary color based on a given color.
triad: Get a triad color based on a given color.
rectangle: Get a rectangle color based on a given color.
square: Get a square color based on a given color.
